data.meta_site_name: Capuchin Poor Clares - Denver | Our Lady of Light Monastery
data.text:
Welcome to St. Patrick Oratory

This Spanish Colonial Revival style mission church was begun in 1907 and completed in 1910. At the time of its construction, the Mission style was considered unusual in the city of Denver, although reflective of its Western character. It was the second church to serve St. Patrick’s parish, which was the first Roman Catholic parish established west of the South Platte River in 1881. The church served both the working class of the Platte River Valley and the upper middle-class professionals of the Highlands neighborhood.

The Capuchin Poor Clares invite you to pray and worship with them. Please see the list of services below.
